plurals.name: possible_exposure_subheading
plurals.item: You were near someone %1$d day ago who has shared their positive COVID-19 test result.
You were near someone %1$d days ago who has shared their positive COVID-19 test result.

resources.string: Welcome to the Sample Public Health Authority COVID-19 App
[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority]\n\n

[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority] 

These notifications are designed to notify you if you've been exposed to a user who later reports themselves as testing positive for COVID-19. You can choose to turn off these notifications at any time. 

Exposure notifications rely on the sharing and collecting of random IDs. These IDs are a random string of numbers that won't identify you to other users and change many times a day to protect your privacy. 

Your device will collect and share random IDs with nearby devices. This app can notify you if you've been near someone who has reported a positive COVID-19 test result. 

If you test positive for COVID-19, you can also help your community by reporting your test result. 

If you’re exposed, the time, approximate date, and distance of your exposure are shared with this app. This helps health experts better understand the spread of COVID-19. These details aren’t associated with your random IDs to protect your privacy.
It\'s important to your community to share a positive test result

[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority] 

If you have a positive COVID-19 test result, sharing this information will help notify others who have been exposed. This will help others in your community contain the spread of COVID-19. 

A positive COVID-19 test result isn't reported automatically. This app lets you report your positive test result securely and without identifying you to other users.
You can\'t share your positive test results until exposure notifications are turned on
[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority]
[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority]
You can manage exposure notifications in your device’s settings.

These notifications are designed to notify you if you've been exposed to a user who later reports themselves as testing positive for COVID-19. You can choose to turn off these notifications at any time. 

Exposure notifications rely on the sharing and collecting of random IDs. These IDs are a random string of numbers that won't identify you to other users and change many times a day to protect your privacy. 

Your device will collect and share random IDs with nearby devices. This app can notify you if you've been near someone who has reported a positive COVID-19 test result. 

If you test positive for COVID-19, you can help your community by reporting your test result. 

If you're exposed, the time, approximate date, and distance of your exposure are shared with this app. This helps health experts better understand the spread of COVID-19.
[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority]
[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority] \n\nOnly those who have been exposed will receive a notification
The unique test identifier that came with your COVID-19 test must be used to verify your positive test result.
The test date helps the app know when you may have been contagious and notify the right people of possible exposure.
Thank you for sharing your test result
[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority]
[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority]
Your test result wasn\'t shared. This test result is saved in the app. You can share or delete your test result at any time.
If you have tested positive for COVID-19, sharing your test result will help notify others who may have been exposed. This will let others in your community know if they should monitor for symptoms.
[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority]

If you have tested positive for COVID-19, you can help your community by reporting your test result. 

You'll be asked to share your phone's random IDs from the past 14 days. This is used to help notify others you've been near about potential exposure. 

Sharing your random IDs won't identify you to other users.
[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority]
[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority]
Your test result will be deleted from this app
[Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority]
When exposure notifications are turned off, you won\’t be notified if you\'re exposed to COVID-19
You will be notified if you have been exposed to someone who reported a positive COVID-19 result
Sample Public Health Authority App received info on %1$s. \n\nThis report has been saved to this app and you can access it at any time.
This person\'s test result was verified. You were near this person on %1$s.
Next steps: [Actual copy to be provided by Public Health Authority]
